name: Trung Diep
review: If you love Poke bowls this is the place! 10/10. The food and fish are super fresh and tasty. You also get unlimited toppings and if you want more rice or salad while you're eating you can ask for more free of charge. First time having poke ‚Ä¶

name: Ibrahim Sheikh
review: An unbelievable poke bowl for the cost. The ingredients and fish are fresh, the bowls are very pretty and the unlimited toppings is a huge plus. It is a lot of food for only about $7 USD and the eatery is very comfortable. Highly recommend.

name: Caitlin McMenamin
review: Fresh and delicious food! I came at lunchtime and had to wait in line for a long time as they were preparing lots of Grab orders. I was impressed by the price (180 000 dong) given you can choose unlimited toppings for free. Very worthwhile!

name: Nhung Nguyen
review: Very fresh bowl with colorful. The price is 180k a little high for a mixed bowl which is already listed in menu. The space is small with only 2 staffs while a lot of guest queue and online orders, so avoid go to eat on peak hours.

name: Ruby Schlaker
review: Some of the most delicious poke I have ever had!! So many options and helpful friendly staff :) Great value for money, they really pack in as many topping as they can! Highly recommend.

name: M Green
review:
Excellent little place to grab a healthy meal. It has a large area inside with air conditioning and a few nice open air tables outside. To get there, you have to walk through the "garage"/ground floor, up a flight of stairs in the back and you will see it on your left about 15m after you hit the first floor.

The ordering was explained to me very well and was easily done (think Chipotle but poke). I ordered sushi rice with tofu and 2x spicy salmon and many fresh toppings. Excellent tasting, fresh, cool air and atmosphere.

name: Lan Nguyen
review: For the price of 180k you get to pick and choose your own sushi (up to two choices).  For the base they have salad, brown rice, and sushi rice.  You can choose a combination and do half rice nd half salad for example.  They have plenty of toppings to choose from in which you can select until the bowl is completely full.  I selected at leastt 6 toppings and all of them were pretty good.

name: Katie Coulson
review: 10/10 food and service. Ingredients are so fresh and taste delicious considering they‚Äôre so healthy! I love the way you order to build your own bowl as I can be fussy with food. I will 100% be back several times before the end of my trip.

name: Karim F. Nappo
review: I love Poke Saigon! The food is so fresh and I feel great when I leave. It's also delicious. The bowls are well priced, the service is always great, and the food always tastes delicious. I'm never disappointed when I visit.

name: chris an
review:
Some sanitary issues:

1) putting spoon on top of charity box. Money is very dirty and no napkins or barrier placed between spoon and the slot where people put money was a little surprising!

2) The food specifically cream was touching the side of the counter. Even if the serving counter is clean nobody wants there food to be touching any part of the counter!

3) 2 workers were smoking. So the smoke went to me and I was smelling and inhaling  2nd hand smoke while the wind blew it towards my direction.

Food is good but portions are quite small for the price. I eat poke bowls quite often in my home country and the price is similar but the portions here are not filling.

name: Kaylyn Goh
review:
I bought a regular poke bowl for 180k VND, which gives 2 scoops of proteins and unlimited toppings. While the food might be pricey compared to other food options you can find, the poke bowl was worth it! Fresh ingredients with a whole lot of toppings, which made the poke bowl much more yummy. My only gripe would be the relatively small portion of salmon/ shrimps given for proteins.

Also a small note that the restaurant is located on the higher floors, so you'd have to walk through a bike shop and up a flight of stairs to get to the restaurant

name: Eddy Philippe
review: It‚Äôs one of those hidden-on-purpose gems in HCMC. The entrance looks like a Vespa cemetery, but once you climb the stairs, nothing but cute little businesses! The staff was super attentive and helped me out with ingredient selection, which I didn‚Äôt need because the menu was bilingual! You get unlimited toppings, and the whole was super flavorful and fresh. Very similar to the poke experience in the good ole US of A. ‚Ä¶ and it‚Äôs air conditioned! Highly recommended !

name: Matthias
review: Fresh ingredients and great taste. Staff is very friendly too. You can choose as many toppings as you like. The place is a little hidden, you have to walk through the blue door and up to the first floor, just keep walking :)

name: Angelica Leong San Loi
review: Super super delicious and healthy poke bowl, must try in Vietnam. The gate is a little shabby, but the interior decoration and design is simple and modern with lots of greenery. Can‚Äôt pay by card only cash.

name: Linh Vo
review:
delicioussss i really like the sauce and the wide selection of toppings. the best poke place i‚Äôve had in saigon so far.

180k for a bowl with 2 scoops of protein, add an extra scoop for 40k. kinda pricey yes but it‚Äôs a treat yourself type of day

name: Kelvin Tan, Real Estate Agent
review:
delicious poke bowl. love the combination of spicy salmon and tuna. you can add any additional topping plus free salad and brown serving if you want more.

the ambience is great. comfortable sitting to get away from hustle and buzz of HCM for a quick lunch.

it is located on 1st floor next to Maki Japanese restaurant. you can climb  stairs up.

name: Jos√© Luis Griffo Chac√≥n
review:
I went today to have a falafel bowl for lunch. The experience was really positive, the place was neat and the decoration is nice. The food itself was beautifully presented, and it was tasty, balanced and good. I will definitely come back!

Special mention to the service, I was happy to see that the stuff were well trained and managed

name: Mai Lakhana
review:
Poke Saigon is the best shop for Healthy food.
There are many things.
Very fresh ingredients
Orange+ carrot juice is so delicious and fresh.
Staffs are very nice.
This shop decorated nicely.
I feel great there.

You can park motorcycle downstairs and pay 10,000 vnd

name: Amanda Toth
review:
Lovely fresh poke bowls! Although not directly located on the street front, I found this easy to find nonetheless. Trust Google maps!

This was so good I ended up ordering it for delivery the next night.

name: Alex Hayden
review: Best Poke I‚Äôve had since I‚Äôve left NZ! Fresh ingredients and friendly staff and great ambiance. Will be back soon :)

name: Azzira Azli
review: Fresh ingredients and satisfying poke meal! Love the vibe - good place to chill. Try their juices - the guava & cucumber is delish.

name: M V
review: Great poke place in Saigon! The place is a bit hidden, but worth the search üòâ. You can pick and choose the base, toppings etc and make your own poke mix.

name: Diana Alvarez Kaba
review:
Super cute place, excellent and generous poke and very friendly service. I'd come back!
Ps: don't get discouraged by the semi sketchy entrance, the place is wonderful upstairs.

name: Lan L1
review: Excellent food and excellent staffs, i cant ask for more.If you have a chance to visit this city, this lovely restaurant is a must-to-go.

name: Nguyen Vo Kim Khanh
review: Food is fine, the space is quite small and crowded especially during lunch time on weekdays

name: Jason Cheung
review: Great place, fresh ingredients and variety.  Great vibe the only complaint would be better signage of finding the place.  Friendly staff.

name: Patryk
review: Great healthy food! Would recommend to anyone that wants to try something different in the area.

name: Sia
review: One of the best poke I ever tried! Ingredients really tasty. Staff is so sweetü§ç

name: Karishma Manwani
review: Amazing poke. Freshly made and delicious combination! Very very tasty

name: Ari Pham
review:
Spacious, beautifully decorated store. Coconut 40k VND. Their main business is poke. Cafe and drinks are complementary business. Eco friendly utilities: coconut bowls, grass straws.

Cash only, no cards, no e-wallets allowed.

Edited review: Staffs talked very loud and shouted to each other across the big room.from the poke bar to coffee bar. The noise are coming from staffs, not other customers. No regards for customers

name: ForGetMeNot
review:
It's little difficult to find this restaurant when you come at the first time
However, I was there twice during my stayingüòÄ
Very cute decoration restaurant.
Fresh, tasty, nice presentation and friendly staffs
Price is acceptable
Recommendedüëç

name: Erica Lin
review: Husband and I are from California we live in Taiwan now. While on vacation in Saigon, we had the best poke bowl, ever. It doesn‚Äôt get better than this. The flavor is perfect, the price is beyond reasonable. I wish we had one of these in Taiwan. Everything is fresh, clean and kept refrigerated well. The staff was super friendly and informative, we felt warm and welcomed by the hospitality. YOU HAVE TO COME HERE!! Helpful tip: it‚Äôs on the second floor and it doesn‚Äôt have a large sign on the first floor. You‚Äôll see two rows of motorbikes with a pathway to stairs going up. Go up those stairs and you‚Äôll see the delightfully decorated little patio. 5 stars all the way. Keep it up, Poke Saigon!

name: Amanda Isberg
review:
We had lunch here at about one on a Saturday. We managed to snag the last table!

The workers there are so kind and helpful at guiding you through the menu.  I got a salmon/tuna bowl and they added extra sauce and extra salad for me. It was perfect for lunch served with a fresh coconut.

My total came to 190,000 which is about $8usd. Totally worth it for the location and ambiance. Fantastic music selection too. It reminded me perfectly of vacation in Hawaii.

name: Tin Nguyen
review:
it‚Äôs nothing exceptional for me, but because there‚Äôs not many poke places in ho chi minh city so i have to give it good marks‚Ä¶

if you‚Äôre really in need of Poke, then this will satisfy your craving‚Ä¶

name: Simon T Katan
review:
Delicious tasty food.
The staff is very friendly and speaking English perfect.
The only thing that not nice is the entrance and the stairs. But after this a very cute little fast food place that you will enjoy the tastes.
Try it as a quick meal, not a fancy place.

name: Lan T.
review: The cutest hidden gem in district 1 for gourmet poke bowls! While located on the first floor of a run down building, this spot is super chic. The staff speaks English and the food is delicious. For 150k VND, you pick your 2 scoops of protein (tofu included for vegetarians/vegans) then your sauce and unlimited toppings. Again, the toppings are generous and unlimited which include more exotic offerings such as marinated quail eggs. The cold press juices are fresh and tasty. We had the watermelon and guava juices. Indoor seating might be limited during rush hours. Outdoor seating available with nice ambient lighting with candles everywhere complete with chillout music. Next, I'll try the pitaya (dragonfruit) bowls for dessert or breakfast.

name: Oana-Meda Pop
review: Amazing place where we had some of the best food we sampled in Saigon the ingredients were super fresh and prepared with care.the staff is super attentive to your needs speaks excellent English. they saw that I was sad because of a recent incident and came to ask if everything was okay. we asked them questions about the lunar year and they were so genuinely willing to answer and to teach us more about their culture! We love the food and we came here over and over again! You can mix and match ingredients so you get something if you're a vegan a vegetarian or an omnivore. the portions are generous and you will leave feeling very satisfied without the feeling of fullness you get by sampling some of the other local dishes.

name: Marie Raymond
review: So good, do not hesitate to go.  Best poke bowl in town.  Walk in the garage, go up on flight of stairs, it is at the end of the hall.  The girls are nice the food is great.  Enjoy!

name: Oliv√©r Siket
review: Pricey, but good food. Tasty and healthy.

name: Michael San Felipe
review: Subway and Chipotle visited Hawaii and decided to use the freshest ingredients to make Poke bowls. Start with rice or salad or both, then choose your protein, then sauces then toppings. The toppings option is a little overwhelming at first, but the workers are so nice. They can help you decide. Prices are reasonable. And the best part, halfway through your meal, you can ask for more sauce. Definitely worth a visit if you're in the area.

name: Sally Cool
review:
Great food, healthy style with reasonable price!
It‚Äôs located at the 1st floor of the building, so a little bit difficult to find. But trust me, when you see it, it‚Äôs like a bright garden lying inside an old building.
For girls, the meal is just perfect size, with a lot of toppings. I couldn‚Äôt imagine that I could order so much toppings as the lovely staff kept asking me ‚Äúand... and.. do you want something else?‚Äù The staff speaks fluent English.
Just love it! Highly recommend!!!

name: Jessie Do
review:
Ambience: nice cozy ambience with both indoor and outdoor seating
Food: fresh and delicious! The serving size is reasonable too.
Overall a decent experience. However the price can be slightly lower to remain compelling!

name: Ruben A.
review:
Best bowl I had ever!!

It was a little cold inside. I would suggest to use less airconditioning. This is more comfortable and uses less energy.

name: Tamsyn S
review:
Absolutely delicious! So healthy and fresh. They were careful with mine and my friend‚Äôs dietary requirements (Vegetarian & vegan) and you felt good after eating it.

It‚Äôs 120K if you stick with vegetarian and 150K if you have the fish. It‚Äôs pricey but worth it for a nutritious meal.

name: Jian James
review: The rice and salad is great and fresh! A big portion of bowl, definitely good for a guy, with stomach people, suggest to share with two. High recommend

name: Harrison Sheremeta
review: Very tasty and quality poke bowls in the heart of Saigon! We were very impressed with the quality of ingredients, especially since the price was much lower than comparable poke at home. The staff were very friendly and helpful as well! The location is a couple of floors up in the building and there is no elevator, so keep that in mind.

name: n.
review: It's very good! Best poke bowl I've tried. The price is decent (mine total is around VND 200k) and they are generous with the portion. All ingredients are fresh from the carbs, protein salmon down to the veggies. You can feel it that they prepare it with heart! Definitely will come back again!

name: Taro
review: I've had numerous bowls from here and it's always been good. If you like Poke Bowls, this place is a must try in Saigon

name: Chloe Keleny
review: Really really really great poke! Such fresh and good ingredients. Also a great place to sit and really good service. Definitely check this place out :)

name: Duy Linh
review: Good. But need to pay money for parking moto cycle üòÖüòÖ ‚Ä¶

name: Richard Yong
review:
This place is in an old charming building in the heart of town. It's brightly lit and plays cool music. There are many many options on how you can configure yout salad.

And mine was one of the of the best salads I have ever eaten. üëç

name: Srht01 Srht
review:
If you like bowls with vegetables or fruits, I recommend that for you.
The restaurant is above a motorbike shop, you have to go through there and go upstairs. The selection for the vegetables is good, but no that good for vegetarians - I wish there have been more for vegetarians.

The fruit bowl was delicious as well, but the creme was made out of the fruit and ice without oats or common things. Because of this you didn‚Äôt get that saturated.
It depends what you like.

name: Maria K
review: Great poke, wonderful staff! We had the California poke adjusting a bit to our preferences and it was really yummy. The girls working there are really friendly, nice and speak great English. Highly recommend it!

name: SNAFU SNAFU
review: Omgggg!!!! This place is so gooodd!!! Yvy is so sweet and was very helpful with giving recommendations. Thank youuuu ü•πüíï ‚Ä¶

name: Shyn Marie Ebol
review:
Great food and nice chill place.

To get to the place you walk into a motorcylce parking space then a few flight of stairs. It is on the 2nd flr of the building on the far left. It has an outdoor seating and few indoor seating.

The staff will greet you at the counter and will discuss on how to build your own poke bowl. Good thing they speak good amount of English so that will be very helpful for foreigners.

The food was great, seating is quite comfortable, the ambiance is nice and good and the staff are helpful.

I recommend for people who wants to try good and different food.

name: marcus E
review:
What a wonderful and beutiful little gem in the heart of Saigon.
First of all, it is a bit hidden and hard to find from the street.
But once you found it by going up a staircase and walked 10 meters will you find it.
The food is Instagram beautiful, and it actually taste just as good as it looks. Wow..I know!
The price is very good 150 000 for a bowel that will keep you seriously full for a long period.
I would recommend the spicy tuna and brown rice, however, I have just been there once and sure all of the menu is just as tasty.
They have plenty of options and superfriendly staff that speaks great English and there to help you.

name: Mac Macsson
review: It was OK, but not as good as I had hoped. Quite pricy for very simple ingredients and the quality of the lettuce wasn't the best. Also very small portions. Not sure if I will come back.

name: Teacher Graham
review: First Poke and it did not disappoint! Clean and fresh ingredients high quality and made quickly. Beautiful little hidden spot on the second floor with kind staff that had great customer service skills and touched base with us and other customers was nice to see. Worth the dollars for sure will be back again soon :)

name: Mari Kova
review: It‚Äôs just the best! üíØ Anyone can eat here. Anyone can afford it. And Im sure everyone will enjoy it! I absolutely love it! ‚ù§Ô∏è always fresh ingredients, very friendly stuff, cozy atmosphere. I can have Poke bowl every day because of how good it is! Very delicious and super healthy - which is also important! I would give 10 stars if I could! üëèüèº

name: David Harper
review: I struggle with how anyone could give this less than 5 stars. It is great food at a great price with friendly service. You pick whether you want salad, rice or brown rice or mix for a base. You pick 2 seafood, and any mix of other fresh ingredients you want, and sauces to top it off. The flavors were a delight and everything was so fresh. It was incredible. For me I chose a mix salad and rice with spicy tuna, spicy salmon, cucumber, edamame, hot peppers, seaweed, pomegranate, dried seaweed, ginger and topped with spicy sauce and sesame. It was so incredible. My wife selected among less spicy ingredients and loved hers as well. The bowl were more than enough to fulfill a hearty appetite, but you would be hard pressed to leave anything uneaten as the flavors are so good. The 2 bowls along with a buy one get one beer special and a sprite came to 425K VND (about $18.40). We were stuffed and happy when we left. I would highly recommend this place and will certainly be back. Make sure to ask for an extra empty bowl so you can mix things together more as the bowl is so full you cant possibly mix it in just one bowl.

name: James Concepcion
review:
This is a hidden gem in the city. Located on the second floor of a residential building that you need to access via a garage with 40 motorbikes and a tiny stairway. This is probably the best Poke I have had.

You start the same way as most places by stating your base. I and my buddy picked 1/2 brown rice and 1/2 greens. I then picked my protein as octopus and shrimp while my buddy did double salmon.

We then got to salad bar section and we were blown away. This was like a Subway on double steroids as seen in my pictures. There was quail eggs, Japanese radish, guacamole, corn, pineapple, mushrooms, olives, edamame, Kani crab flakes, shisho leaves, sesame seeds, Nori flakes aside from the standard green, purple and curly lettuce, tomatoes, onions, cucumber, spinach, bell peppers and various hot peppers.

I had all the toppings on mine and my bowl weighed in at over a pound. My buddy was a bit reserved and only had standard salad fare with guacamole.

Did I also tell you that after I finished the Poke server asked if I wanted a free refill of the salad toppings. Now I see why this restaurant has a non-stop delivery business and is rated #5 of all restaurants in Saigon on Trip Advisor.

name: Justiina S.
review: Took too long time to order. We waited for 15 minutes and the queue was not moving. Place looked nice, but no AC and lot of waiting we decided to each lunch elsewhere.

name: Agi Ro
review: One of the hidden treasures of the city. Once you arrive to the address, you must walk into a tiny motorbike parking garage room towards a grand staircase at the back. Then just walk up a floor & you'll be outside again, you will see signs for the restaurant along the way. It's kind of hot in the daytime, & super packed for lunch so keep that in mind. ;) But if you manage to get here on a cool, off-lunch time, you'll be taken on a healthy food bowl journey that you get to customize. For the price it's a massive variety, but still pricey in my opinion, a little under 10$ without guac. The staff is super nice, but they might be in the middle of a crazy huge delivery order before they can get to you. Bear with them & your bowl will be extra tasty. Happy this exists in Saigon!

name: Dex Nguyen
review: Really nice English speaking staff. She was helpful and helped us picking the ingredients for our first time trying Poke. The ingredients are fresh enough and the proportion is as you can see, huge. We asked for and they happily added more sauce to our tastes. The drinks are fresh and the bottle design is nice as well. We couldn't be happier to having found a new favorite food place.

name: Alexander Banks
review: Amazing and delicious poke bowls! Hidden away up a sketchy stair case inside a scooter garage, you would never expect such a gem being hidden away. Lovely service with great English skills helped us get a nice bowl üòä ‚Ä¶

name: Shoe ‚ÄúShoe‚Äù Thompson
review:
150k for a bowl.

Easy to order with a lot of free reign for what your want. Cool quiet lounge-y place.

If you get anything from this review get this: add the red pickled cabbage. It's the perfect taste whilst mixed in alright. ü§®

Don't second guess me-- it's sweet and sour and tangy and crunchy. Just do it and think of me.

name: meg bishop
review: Ate here for lunch and had the most amazing poke bowl I‚Äôve had in Ho Chi Minh yet! The girls who work here are really nice and can‚Äôt do enough to help you! A regular poke bowl is 160k and 100% worth it! Really lovely interior too. Can‚Äôt wait to come back!

name: Hanna Mickiewicz
review: It's a cute place hidden in one of Saigon's apartment buildings. Everything is super clean and there are some comfortable seats. I haven't tried their poke but I had a pitaya bowl. It was tasty but I feel like some extra toppings would make it even better. The smoothie part was frozen - basically like a sorbet.

name: Lam Tran
review: This is not my first time here in Poke. Fresh meal, lovely staffs and cozy place. Every time i come back is always new experiences with Poke bowl. Vy is really kind and take care of me and my Poke. Best poke in town so far

name: H
review: Amazing place. You make your own poke bowl with a base of rice, salad or both, then add raw fish and lots of other ingredients and sauces. Everything is so fresh and delicious and very reasonably priced. Staff is also very friendly and helpful. If I lived in HCMC I would definitely be a regular here.

name: Minh L√¢m
review: I was come here with my friends. I saw the information on google the operating time will be at 10 a.m. I came here at 10:15‚Äô am and sit here about 5 mins. The staff still indifferent with us, cold welcome and it was almost 11 am that the food was ready to be ordered, but not single staff came to our table and asked us even though we waited a long time. When foreign guests leave, they are warmly say goodbye, in other hand  we didn't get any hello or goodbye or thank you from your staff!!! For that price we deserve better!

name: Princess Coconut
review: All looks great and health . Low carb diet, I love this place .  Just it‚Äôs not easy to find the place in Saigon

name: Uy Le
review: Always fresh and has a variety of toppings to choose from. After trying poke at a few different places, I still think Poke Saigon is the best. This location is quite small and cozy, but very nice nonetheless.

name: Mari Ahlquist
review:
Amazing Poke and really nice and friendly staff! Probably the best poke I've ever had. A modern, calm place to eat.
Not the easiest to find as it is on the first floor.

name: Trang Ngo
review: Delicious! Cozy atmosphere. I like it a lot. But one portion is a bit too much for me. I wish they serve a smaller bowl.

name: Annalena Schmitt
review: I still can‚Äôt get over how delicious that was. Everything is super fresh, the staff is insanely kind and speaks perfectly English. You can even get a refill of rice or salad for free. Best restaurant in Ho Chi Minh. 100% recommend!!

name: Khanh Do
review: Good quality poke. Staff is friendly and hospitable. They do care about customer experience. Always happy when coming here.

name: Matilda Wood
review: Been here many times since 2019 and it's always nice. The staff is lovely, especially Vy. The brown rice here is another new level of brown rice here.

name: Roxy
review: Always amazing poke here! You can make a vegan poke bowl by choosing tofu and sesame-soy dressings with the right toppings. So delicious! It‚Äôs 120k vnd for a vegetarian/vegan bowl (150k for a regular bowl).

name: Sascha D'Altobrando
review: Very very nice place, it seams to be hosted in an apartment. The girls are very gentle and patient with us foreigners. The food is excellent and served best. Highly recommended. The place is a little bit hidden and not easy to find and the entrance might discourage, but do not hesitate and reach the first floor...you won't regret it üòâüëç2 ‚Ä¶

name: Alvaro Zumaran
review: Delicious and nutritious options. If you don't feel like constructing your own bowl, there are recommendations that you can choose from.  Pictured: California and Hawaiin. Prices are on the board (ranges from 150k and up)

name: James Green
review: Really nice place for a poke bowl in saigon. super fresh ingredients. Great staff too, especially Vy, she was super helpful and very polite. Will definitely be back

name: Matias Szostak
review: The place is amazing, great food, very clean and comfy. For around 160.000 you can eat a poke with almost everything they have, and you can refill it with some ingridients later!

name: Mark Dewey
review: Subway style choose your own pokebowl. Choose rice, toppings, sauces etc. ¬£5, 150000d. Delicious and filling. Ingredients taste very fresh and staff are incredibly kind and friendly. Worth the trip.

name: Laura-Christine Schmidt
review: Most amazing poke bowl ever! So delicious! And a great variety to chose from. The staff was really friendly, helpful and spoke English perfectly. The restaurant is really cute just a little bit hidden. I will definitely come back!

name: Milla Parviainen
review: Beautiful and delicious bowls, 150k each. Wonderful and friendly staff who walked us through to make our bowls. The location is so cute too!

name: Ed OD
review: Fantastic poke bowl with about 20 kinds of toppings and 7 sauce options. Every bowl custom made for you. 45k tete craft beer from  6-8pm too. Left stuffed for 150k dong.

name: Anh Luu
review: The place overall is nice! However, the staff kinda has a discriminative attitude towards my friend, whom used Vietnamese to order food. Later, she told me that the staff has a certain attitude towards her probably she used Vietnamese to order instead of using English, which I amnot sure to be honest. The food is great, though!

name: Patricia Schnepper Gans
review: Delicious! The entrance of the building is a little suspicious, but head to the 1st floor and you'll find a great place for a delicious meal.

name: Hde214
review: Friendly and helpful staff. Absolutely delicious poke! A must if you‚Äôre craving something fresh!

name: Anna Ziouzina
review:
I love pok√© & this charming little shop (tucked safely away from the hustle & bustle) did not disappoint! Ingredients were all fresh & offered great combination. They have a nice range of poke/fish items & the largest selection of toppings I've seen. The two staff members were both very sweet & accomodating - one of them even opened up my coconut I'd purchased earlier from a street vender - going above & beyond in service!

If you're looking for a quiet place to grab a bite, I definitely recommend this location (over the busier one over in the main street). The freshly made watermelon juice was delicious too - will definitely be back whenever in HCM ‚ô•Ô∏è!

name: Daphne Tan
review: Hidden gem! If you‚Äôre craving for a good pokebowl, this is a must-go. Very good quality and friendly good english speaking staff. A bit hard to find but it‚Äôs totally worth it. You can put unlimited toppings and they also have nice juices and pitaya/smoothie bowls üëç ‚Ä¶

name: Gemma Crowley
review: The best place to eat in Ho Chi Minh! Amazing fresh, tasty, nutritious food served with a warm welcoming smile. Couldn't recommend this place more. üòÅ ‚Ä¶

name: Melissa Rosero
review: Been living in HCMC for a year now and this place is legit yummy and safe.  I‚Äôve gotten food poisoning a couple times from raw fish in this city so I‚Äôm definitely on the sensitive side and I‚Äôve never had a problem here! 150k isn‚Äôt cheap but I don‚Äôt recommend eating any cheap raw fish while visiting

name: Eleanor Metcalfe
review: Had a really tasty poke bowl. Often it is difficult to get a vegetarian meal however they did really delicious falafel. They also have fresh juices which are so refreshing. The staff were really lovely and gave us loads of information about Ho Chi Minh and Hanoi. Would definitely go back again if we weren't leaving!

name: Shimi Liderman
review: Wow! Such a special spot. It just oozes style and good vibes. Tucked away in a unique location on the 1st floor of a residential building, this beautiful little Poke shop serves a variety of super fresh ingredients with which you can build your own perfect bowl of Poke. They also serve Pitaya bowls, freshly pressed juices and fresh coconuts. Do yourself a favor and go üëçüèª

name: Kiwi Kiwi
review:
Really lovely Poke - salad with salmon!
Pick the mix of ingredients and the poke is created before your üëÄ eyes.
If you want a healthy green and salmon lunch - this is a top pick In Saigon! ‚Ä¶

name: Minh Anh H·ªì Hu·ª≥nh
review: Best place to have yourself a perfect Poke Bowl ü§© fresh ingredients in a cozy atmosphere. Keep it up Poke Saigon!! ‚Ä¶

name: Minh To Xuan
review: It is quite good for the price range. Very delicious food.

name: Hedonicarus
review: Very tasty and satisfying. You can build your own poke and choose as many toppings as you want (except the actual poke).

name: Grace Gin
review: Best poke bowl in HCMC! everything is nice and clean, plus price is reasonable. Def recommended!

name: richard amero
review:
Vegan and vegetarian options available; I only came here to keep my vegan gf happy but I absolutely loved it.
Construct your dish yourself (think Subway on crack, but no bread)
I went for sushi rice, raw salmon sashimi, prawn, spicy mayo wakame, edamame, mushroom, eggplant, radish and sauerkrau, all topped with fried shallots and chili powder.  It was so delicious, that they won't even need to wash my bowl up.
However, I did have huge problems finding the place (I was literally stood outside and still didn't realize I was there) but it was still worth it

name: V D
review: Cute location and sells poke. Fish quality has been good so far so definitely worth a visit for a quick lunch.

name: Trinh Thai
review:
The place is nice and Poke is good as always. But the only problem is accepting cash only üò≠üò≠üò≠. Remember to bring cash with you since they wont change to other payment method any soon.
Still I enjoy the vibe and the food ü•ò ‚Ä¶

name: Alex Boon
review: Great little restaurant tucked away on 1st floor accessed via a flight of stairs inside a building. Delicious fresh Poke, friendly staff and a nice chilled atmosphere!

name: Mark Brown
review: Fantastic salads! "Poke" is Hawaiian for raw fish (salmon and tuna), but that's not the point of the Poke restaurant. They take a bowl, fill it with rice or lettuce and other fresh chopped vegetables, then top it with cold fish or tofu. Delicious! The interior is spacious, minimalist and comfortable, and the clientele is young and energetic.

name: Thanh Th·ªßy ƒê·ªó
review:
My favorite poke resto in 3 years but not anymore!!

The food tastes very good but they often run out some sorts of topping/protein in early evening, every single time!!

Recently for me the staff are not friendly. They usually chit chat loudly but whisper in each other‚Äôs ear while talking to customers. It‚Äôs not very polite. Here we can refill but they don‚Äôt seem to be welcoming?!

I think I have to find poke somewhere else.

name: Javier Eduardo S√°nchez
review: Very tasty üòã Staff is great and speak English very well. Definitely going back next time I go to Saigon. ‚Ä¶

name: Pierre Vercueil
review: Really good Pok√©! Really adorable owners. Avoid midday in the week though - can get very busy with lunch crowd.

review: Amazing place! the food was delicious, super healthy, the place really peaceful and nice, hidden but great!! I will come back for sure. The service is really cute too. A bit expensive (150k) but the bowl was quite big so it made me 2 meals. Don't hesitate at all!

review:
Delicious, fresh food! So many choices to make your own pok√© and decent portion sizes. The staff were really friendly and happy to talk us through the various options and ingredients. They even came to check we were happy with our food and if we wanted more sauce or toppings.
It's a little hidden away though, upstairs over a carpark/bike shop (Google Maps will bring you here though) and a small sign outside. It's worth finding it though! It has the cutest roof garden too to sit and enjoy your meal!
Highly recommend it!

name: H∆∞∆°ng Th·ªßy Tr·∫ßn Ng√¥
review:
Service, space and overall experience is worth the price.
Serving size is a bit much for me though, but the fish and shrimps are fresh and juicy.
Highly recommend. Would return some day.

review: The place is a bit hard to find, but the premises are quiet and lovely decorated. The staff is English-speaking, very friendly and will help you create your own bowl with rice or salad base, various sea food and toppings. name: quinh Vu
review: In saigon for 3 years, and still go (or order) from this place every week! keep it fresh and healthy!

name: Beth Sands
review: Delicious pok√© bowls and super friendly service üòÉ ‚Ä¶

name: Madison Rose
review: The poke bowls are amazing!! It's a little hidden gem, literally hidden on the first floor above a parking garage for motorbikes. Once find your way tjere you will not be disappointed. I highly recommend Poke Siagon for anyone who loves a fresh invigorating meal!!

review: A lunch stalwart during my time in Saigon. Consistently delicious, with generous portions and friendly staff. Prices are a little high compared to other restaurants of the same type, but to be fair, it is the best quality compared to tbose other restaurants too.

review: I had never had poke bowls before coming here... It was so good. So fresh, ample size. I asked for heaps of toppings and they just loaded if up. Shrimp was a highlight of my bowl. If I was her in Saigon longer I'd be back to eat again :D

review:
Had lunch here and it was very good. A lot of different ingredients to chose from, rice, salad or mix of both as base, salmon and tuna, natural or spicy, shrimps, octopus, etc. and a variety of different dressings.
Huge choice of veggies and fruit, as well as some crunchy toppings.
I give only 4 stars because the prices are quite high, nearly the same as back home in Munich, and the serving size isn‚Äôt very big. I ordered a fresh coconut as drink, it came unchilled, I prefer my coconut water fresh out of the freezer üòâ
But in terms of flavor & location I would absolutely recommend this place.

name: Lukas
review: Unbelievable good bowl, was better than in Hawaii! And a lot cheaper ;)

name: Ngan Le
review: Love this place! They has super healthy food and passionate staff.

review: Simply delicious meal! The staff were very friendly and spoke English very well. They were happy to explain and give recommendations based on my preferences. It's more than enough food, and only AUD$9. The food is fresh, colourful and tastes amazing. Air con, WiFi, cute couches and benches,  what more could you want?

name: Jennifer Ng
review: A friend and I were in town having an experience.  Though familiar with consuming this style of food for maintaining the body, it was pleasant to happen upon the Poke Bowl concept.  The staff were friendly, efficient, and ever patient as we navigated an abundant selection. The environment was well-maintained and offerings were fresh, varied, and nutritious to suit different needs for meeting energetic requirements.  Mushrooms, brown rice, nori, wakame, sprouts, beans, beets, sesame, and so on at a reasonable cost and capacity for refilling certain ingredients.  We dined at both locations in Ho Chih Minh and are grateful to this establishment for providing access to clean, simple, nutritious meals served with kindness.  Much appreciation and wishes for your well-being.

name: Adi Nissim
review: Great place. Great and fresh food. The staff are super nice and speak great English.

name: Carlos De Ory

review: This place is great! It's a more modern style poke than the traditional Hawaiian style I grew up eating almosy every day. Toppings I added were onions, cucumber, ginger, raddish, green onion, wakame, and crab salad, fried shallots nori, and sesame seeds in the original shoyu saucr. Boom! I will definitely be back for more. Mahalo!

name: yvhnank

name: 194anm
review: This place is really amazing. It is a hidden spot in an old building, with awesome decoration and great tropical vibe. The staffs are super friendly and the ingredients are always fresh and healthy, especially salmon and tuna here are the freshest fishes I've try...More

name: Passport758687
review: Poke Saigon is the best place with the best food i have ever tried in my life. At noon with the lovely sunlight it makes here looks so beautiful. Decorating in here looks very pretty. It has many cool views more than in Poke Nguyen...More

name: jarod496
review: Heathly and tasty food. Many flavores and dresses. perfect for the lunch or a snak. you can't find more tasty et fresh for this price.

name: skatdare
review: Poke Saigon is a great place nicely tucked in inconspicuous location. Once you get in, you're greeted by cosy surroundings, friendly owner, helpful staff and a great poke bowl selection. The ingredients are fresh & healthy. You can either select from the popular selection or...More

name: Juliebubu
review: The Poke was just so fresh and delicious! Also really enjoyed spending time in the restaurant as it is so well decorated and cosy and the staff is really smily and nice.I really recommend Poke Saigon to anyone willing to enjoy healthy and tasty food...More

name: kaderk218
review: It surprises me every time for the new when ever I come to eat Poke here. The ingredients are amazing and the Salmon is reaaaaaally good. The staff nice and the place very clean. Highly recommend. I will be back here often.

name: ChauDang2612
review: This one is the 2nd location of Poke Saigon. Same amazing food quality. Upgraded design and decoration. This one is also in an old apt building in the center yet less crowded and hectic than their first poke house. The design is super lovely and...More

name: rubenvietnam
review: I never imagine I could like a plate that looks like a salad so much. I've never been too much into salads and those things specially when compared to things like burgers and BBQ ribs, but this place touched my heart in a special way....More

name: Raphael W
review: Fresh and tasty Poke Bowls inside a hidden spot. Great vibes! It's at the end of the 1st floor. They have great cold pressed fruit juices as well.

name: Jennieinthebottle

name: Stephanie C
review: I've been to a few Poke places around the city but Poke Saigon stands out the most. Ingredients are top quality, the place is beautifully designed and the music is great. Will obviously come back again!

name: TBinh
review: Serving healthy foods and delicious drinks that everyone likes, a challenge that Poke Saigon has surely taken up with panache by inaugurating this second restaurant in a peaceful and stylish setting decorated with care, taste and elegance. name: GNS589

name: aaronchiang
review: Back in Saigon and had to come to Poke Saigon. This is their second shop and it‚Äôs even better than the first! The quality of the food is top notch as expected. Gotta get the new shiso miso sauce!! Nom nom nom.

name: Djrick_08
review: A nice little spot, the freshest salmon with a very reasonable price. Friendly stuff , they also suggest you what to mix with your poke bowl.

name: pamelie
review: With its tropicool atmosphere and healthy yet tasty "poke bowls", it's the perfect spot for a quiet lunch or diner with friends. The terrasse is very enjoyable, the staff super friendly, and the food never disappointing. I love it !

name: anniep297
review: Wow! The food is so fresh and fulfilling! You get a lot for what you pay for and the staff is very knowledgable and friendly. I can also recommend their yummy, fresh juices.
